title: U.S. Looks to Reorient Ties With Saudi Arabia Over Oil Production Cut
description: Saudi leaders decided earlier this month to join Russia in leading a cartel of oil producers to announce cutting production by two million barrels a day, which could raise prices and help Russia.

title: Reports of Looting in Kherson as Ukrainians Battle to Retake the City
description: As Russia pressures local residents to leave, a hydroelectric dam outside the city may prove to be a major point of contention.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Iran’s Protests Intensify
description: Plus Myanmar gets closer to Russia and a dire climate report.

title: WHO Lists Top Fungi Health Threats
description: The pathogens cause infections that kill millions of people each year and often go undiagnosed. Even when identified, a growing number of infections is resistant to the current crop of drugs.

title: US Sanctions Target Russian Efforts to Manipulate Politics in Moldova
description: Moldova, like its neighbor Ukraine, wants closer relations with the West but has long battled Russian political interference and intimidation.

title: US Sanctions Target Russian Efforts to Manipulate Politics in Moldova
description: Moldova, like its neighbor Ukraine, wants closer relations with the West but has long battled Russian political interference and intimidation.

title: Dutch Are Investigating Reported Illegal Chinese Police Stations
description: Reports by news media and a human rights group say Chinese police forces opened two offices in the Netherlands that are used to intimidate Chinese citizens.

title: Israeli Blockade in West Bank Angers Palestinians
description: To fight a growing insurgency, the Israeli Army has closed off several entrances to a major Palestinian city, harming its economy and stirring more protest.

title: Russia Intensifies Its Propaganda Campaign Against Ukraine
description: A new push by the Kremlin frames the war as a counterterrorism operation and seeks to rally Russians to support the fight, officials and researchers say.

title: When Soup and Mashed Potatoes Are Thrown, Can the Earth Win?
description: The van Gogh and Monet paintings targeted in recent climate protests were unharmed. But a debate about tactics rages.

title: Thousands in Iran Mourn Mahsa Amini, Whose Death Set Off Protests
description: In her hometown and across the country, large demonstrations erupted marking 40 days of mourning for Ms. Amini, who died in police custody.

title: The Case of Mexico’s 43 Missing Students Was Solved. Then It Fell Apart
description: This summer, the government said it had uncovered what happened during the 2014 mass abduction. Arrest warrants quickly followed. But since then, the criminal case and the new account have unraveled.

title: New UK Leader Rishi Sunak Faces a Bruising First Prime Minister’s Questions
description: The opposition’s lines of attack, starting with Mr. Sunak’s choice of home secretary and his wife’s wealth, gave a glimpse of where it sees vulnerabilities in the governing Conservatives.

title: A Social Media Status Update
description: Top social media apps are struggling after a decade of dominance.

title: A 23-Million-Year-Old Fossil Is Carried Away by Parties Unknown
description: The whale fossil, a cherished local attraction, was taken from a riverbank in broad daylight by two men with a rock saw and chisel, residents say.

title: Shunned by the West, Russia and Myanmar Form a Partnership of Unequals
description: Myanmar gets resources and ammunition, while Russia gets a customer at a time when it is struggling for revenues. Both can use the other to undermine Western sanctions.

title: Frida Kahlo, Diego Rivera and More: Visiting Mexico City’s House Museums
description: Curiosity about the daily lives of the famous draws us to the places they lived. In Coyoacán it’s possible to commune with the ghosts of Frida Kahlo, Diego Rivera, Leon Trotsky and more.

title: Read Your Way Through Istanbul
description: Istanbul is unfathomable: old and new, real and surreal, melancholic and absurd. Elif Shafak, one of its foremost novelists, reveals its secrets.

title: Biden Warns Russia Against Nuclear Attack Amid Mounting Alarm
description: President Biden told Russia it would be a “serious mistake” to use tactical nuclear weapons. His comments reflect growing worry among allies that Moscow may be searching for a pretext for a radiological attack.

title: Climate Pledges Are Falling Short, and a Chaotic Future Looks More Like Reality
description: With an annual summit next month, the United Nations assessed progress on countries’ past emissions commitments. Severe disruption would be hard to avoid on the current trajectory.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Tensions are flaring between Germany and its allies.
